Articles.Content:
Hey all, does anyone have experience using Klockheed Martian Gimbal?

I just finished a linear aerospike engine and added a KM Gimbal module to it but it's acting a bit funky... I can set the +X and -X axis gimbal in the editor just fine, but when I put it on the runway it's backwards:

Edit: It also twitches a lot when SAS is on and over-corrects wayyy too much, causing the craft to flip out of control.

![dSKcsYSh.png](http://i.imgur.com/dSKcsYSh.png)

How does each part need to be oriented in respect to each other and the global/local axis?

Here's the setup in Unity. I can provide more pictures if necessary. Thanks!

![XLQYkKTh.png](http://i.imgur.com/XLQYkKTh.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-29T05:00:36Z" title="05/29/2015 05:00  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 29, 2015</time> by Quiznos323**

So I fixed the problem with the gimbal direction being backwards, but it is still flipping out of control when I uses SAS ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif). I tried replacing the km\_Gimbal module with a stock ModuleGimbal but then nothing gimbals at all. All my attempts at gimballing nozzles have been successful except for this one, but I don't know where I went wrong... Is there something wrong in the hierarchy above?

I cant help on this but recently all of my gimbals have been going crazy when SAS is engaged. I've updated a bunch of my mods and I think maybe mechjeb is doing it. going to uninstall my mods one at time to who is the culprit. Sorry if this is off your topic
